these guys are German thrash metal
heavyweights this is their 13th
full-length album and with a few lineup
changes they have been steadily
releasing material since they started in
the mid 80s and have released some
pretty notable metal records in that
time like pleasure to kill especially
pleasure to kill and coma of souls just
really bringing that speedy fast and
ultra aggressive thrash metal sound from
the late 80s and early 90s together with
some really kind of sacrilegious imagery
and messages and though they did start
incorporating some elements of a very
kind of dark moody gothic rock on some
of their albums that were released in
the 90s they never really ventured all
too far from their renren rash sound
they're certainly staying ahead of some
of their more slightly over produced
contemporaries like overkill or Megadeth
they're even sounding better than some
of their fellow Germans although I will
say that last Sodom record had a really
raw freakin badass
rough-around-the-edges sound just really
but anyway this new album from Creator
is a bit of a change it's not really
just the the thrash and bash of their
previous LP they really do try to refine
their sound with more melody more
harmony some really kind of epic
choruses a lot of the riffs and core
progressions feel much more righteous
this time around system feelings of
justice coming from some of these songs
and to mention it again the melody and

just doesn't feel that impressive or
it's just kind of passable and I think
that partially has to do with these guys
writing these melodic courses or
executing them rather just about the
same way almost every time they come up
and what's worse is that some of these
courses can come off really kind of
overblown a bit corny and to me kind of
break the momentum of some of these
tracks I prefer the increase in melody
on this album when it's kind of used
subtly into a track that is just totally
badass and balls-to-the-wall like death
to the world but aside from that
increase in melody in that kind of
embrace of Iron Maiden sound just kind
of out of nowhere on this album there's
not many surprises to behold with
phantom antichrist and i'm kind of on
the fence with the production too while
I do think the guitar tone feels okay
there's nothing particularly special
about it and and the drums to me feel so
mechanical they feel so robotic it
doesn't really get me excited or pumped
to hear these guys just riff on some of
these grooves on these tracks rather it
just kind of makes a lot of these songs
feel very paced
very kind of predictable and that just
kills the excitement for me because
thrash is all about a journal
for me I have to give it to creator for
you know not just trying to do the same

to hear them kind of jump ship a little
